DOC.brief_summary: During Cesarean delivery , phenylephrine use maintain patient 's blood pressure . Low blood pressure common side effect spinal medication use anesthetize patient prior start surgery . This low blood pressure also trigger unpleasant side effect nausea , vomit low Apgar score baby . Currently 2 method phenylephrine administration Cesarean section . One method intermittent bolus continuous infusion . It ideal regimen phenylephrine administration maintains blood pressure without compromise cardiac output . In study , cardiac output blood pressure measure transthoracic bioimpedance , new technique noninvasive continuous cardiac output monitoring . The hypothesis study continuous infusion phenylephrine equally effective maintain blood pressure compare intermittent injection , induce less hemodynamic change .
DOC.brief_title: Best Regimen Phenylephrine Administration During Cesarean Section
DOC.criteria: Ability communicate English Elective Cesarean Delivery spinal anesthesia Normal singleton pregnancy beyond 36 week gestation ASA physical status I/II Weight 50100 kg , height 150180 cm Age 18 year Patient refusal Inability communicate English Allergy hypersensitivity phenylephrine Preexisting pregnancyinduced hypertension Cardiovascular cerebrovascular disease Fetal abnormalities History diabetes , exclude gestational diabetes Contraindications spinal anesthesia
